website_summaries.verdict: A value-for-money choice for the winter rider that’s well padded and retains heat well.
pros: The big bonus here is the long cuffs, with zip and velcro closures so they stay snug around your wrists and keep out the cold
Comfortable fit with fleece lining for warmth
cons: Not for long distance cold weather touring

customer_reviews.title: They keep hands warm in the new england winter
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my boyfriend and was looking for gloves flexible enough for riding -- these aren't too padded or anything in the fingers so that works. And I was looking for something to keep his hands warm riding in new england winters -- he said that every part of him was cold but his hands today. So I do recommend these especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal H.

customer_reviews.title: good gloves for cold and wet weather
customer_reviews.text: the gloves work well when driving in town at temperatures lower than 30 deg F (or 0 deg C) and keep fingers warm. The coldest I used them was around 10F (-12 C) and the fingers stay flexible during 20-30 min rides. I used them in one thunderstorm and they keep the water out for about 20 minutes. A minor point is that the dye seems not to be uniform, I got 3-4 'white spots' near the wrists. No size guide is given for these gloves, so I used XXL which I also have in Gore running gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan in KY

customer_reviews.title: Nothing disappointing about these gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These are great gloves. Very comfortable. My hands stayed incredibly warm, including my finger tips, on a 34° ride for 45 miles. No issues whatsoever! Have used several times since I purchased them and I would definitely purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Reynaldo Mendez

customer_reviews.title: They fit!  My husband loves these gloves.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband for those cold winter mornings on his bike. He loves them. First, because they actually fit. He has big hands and was always splitting the seams on the fingers. Second, because they are warm and keep the wind from going up his sleeve. He is very pleased with the gloves. As always shipping was super fast. I don't know how they do it!
customer_reviews.author: leelee h

customer_reviews.title: Budget gloves, yet a viable option
customer_reviews.text: In about 40°F weather riding 55-70 mph, my hands got cold in about 20-25 minutes and my finger tips began to hurt about 5 minutes after that. Pros: -There isnt too much insulation that hurts my hand when gripping the handlebars. -Price. Cons: -The leater isnt very thick and there isnt any impact protection besides the insulation. -They're not the best for fast speeds with cold temperatures as described above.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and very warm
customer_reviews.text: Winters here are somewhat mild but I still needed a better glove for the cooler weather. The gloves fit perfectly, size is exactly as described. The gloves are very warm and look great. I have only worn them once so far, still too warm here to use them exclusively, waiting for a little cooler weather.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Gloves are great for price.
customer_reviews.text: Gloves are great for price seem like they will hold up awhile put about 200 miles on them first time out in about 60 degree weather warm inside but after about 100 miles wearing them leather started stretching. I wear a large with normal size hands gloves fit well at first now a little loose. Overall stitching seems intact I will order these again. UPDATE stitching in fingers is separating from what appears to be very thin cheap leather got about 500 + miles out of gloves worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: XL too long, L is too tight, fingers are not pre-curved.
customer_reviews.text: The XL size is about 3/4" too long in the fingers. The L is the perfect length but too tight. Both cause fatigue when holding the grips for long periods because the fingers are not pre-curved.
customer_reviews.author: Mark (Bump)Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Decent Gloves for the Price
customer_reviews.text: They are pretty decent gloves for the price however, they do not keep my hands warm. Riding in the morning when the temperature is in the mid 30's my hand still get very cold and numb.
customer_reviews.author: William Burnside

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Water proof Durable, well made Hands still get cold on 30 to 40 degree 20 mile ride to work.....but anything thicker would impede my use of hand controls and switches on motorcycle
customer_reviews.author: mike kaestner

customer_reviews.title: Good for cold rides
customer_reviews.text: Wore them this morning it was about 45° out no leaks of cold air fit comfortable 2 downsides i'll mention no grip in the palm and the cuff was almost too short but for the price they're great...
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: They didn't keep my hands warm.
customer_reviews.text: They're very comfortable, but very bulky. My biggest issue is that they didn't really keep my fingers warm. It was over 40 degrees, and my fingers were getting numb after 15 minutes doing 25 MPH. I'm gonna get some heated gloves for next winter.
customer_reviews.author: eric paris

customer_reviews.title: Great riding gloves
customer_reviews.text: Great riding gloves, protect from the cold and wind. Comfortable for long rides and gripping. Would recommend the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Proudmomof4

customer_reviews.title: Alright glove for the price
customer_reviews.text: These winter gloves are very comfortable and warm for riding in mild winters but if the temp is below 40 you may want a more expensive glove. But that's why I gave a Four star but overall nice feeling gloves
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Labbe

customer_reviews.title: Warmer than thinner gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Warm enough with my heated grips to keep me somewhat warmer. If I was wearing nothing I’d be freezing and when I wear these I can feel my fingers after a 30 minute ride in 30 degree weather so I’d say for the price they’re great!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Good fit. Good at keeping hands warm. Have not had a chance to see how they do in wet weather, but I am sure I will be impressed. They are well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: caproberts

customer_reviews.title: Warm enough so far
customer_reviews.text: I ride an e-bike at 25mph and in the cold these gloves so far have worked. We hit 23deg in NYC and I my hands were warm enough on my 15 min ride.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as a gift. They've worn beautifully, fit his large hands, and are very warm. Well worth the money spent!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Nice Fit!!
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are perfect as far as fit and quality. I haven't had a chance to try them in cooler weather yet but my initial thoughts are they will be perfect for keeping my hands warm on those cold spring mornings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice, warm gloves
customer_reviews.text: Very warm on the motorcycle so far. May even try them on the snowmobile this winter. As thick a glove as I’d want to wear while motorcycling thou.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Harrison

customer_reviews.title: A little too bulky for clutch and braking.
customer_reviews.text: They do a great job for keeping your hands warm, but are a little too bulky for me when using the clutch and brake.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie R. Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Good cold weather biker gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Good gloves for very cold weather. They are thick with lots of padding. They seem to be constructed pretty well ...time will tell. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Steelgator

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves them
customer_reviews.text: Great value, good fit and wonderful protection. My cat loves to wrestle and my hand and wrist used to get all chewed and scratched up but with these beauties on I am as safe as can be. He's hanging on with front legs, chewing at my index finger and scratching at my wrist with his back legs and I can't feel a thing. He used to draw blood regularly but he has barely managed to make a mark on these. I don't know if they are any good for motorbike riding but they score 10 out of 10 for cat wrestling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... me through the winter and they are still in good enough shape for next year
customer_reviews.text: Got me through the winter and they are still in good enough shape for next year.
customer_reviews.author: J. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Warm gloves, decent for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves seem to be warm and the quality is decent for the price. The drawback to the gloves is they do not travel up the wrist very far. So when riding they do not go over the riding jacket sleeve and cold car goes up the sleeve of the jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Motorcycle Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I've worn these gloves in near freezing weather on my motorcycle and I can tell you they do an excellent job of keeping your fingers warm. The material and construction is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Arnaldo8802

customer_reviews.title: Bad Zippers Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Zippers are terrible. If the zipper on the right glove didnt break in half easily a 4 star glove. I utilize them into low 30 degree riding with no liners and have rode in single digits with Marino wool liners. Great value just wish the zippers were better.
customer_reviews.author: Woodside1983

customer_reviews.title: Great glove at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and very warm. Roomy enough to manipulate the clutch, lights, horn, etc. These gloves work as well or better than more expensive brands. Only thing I have not experienced is resistance to rain.
customer_reviews.author: Darren  Dailey

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: I live in California near San Jose and ride 43 miles to work on the freeway. I wear glove liners and I have elephant ears on my handle bars. My hands get cold even with these gloves on on
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are just right. Today I rode for 25 minutes at 45-75 mph in 40° weather and my hands did not feel uncomfortable at all. The glove look bulky; however, They do not feel bulky.
customer_reviews.author: D. Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Warm but not durable.
customer_reviews.text: Cuffs keep amazing amount of wind away from you. Definitely warmer. Material could be tougher, especially in wear areas (palms, fingertips). Already torn from clutch handle.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas R.

customer_reviews.title: Stay warm on these cold days
customer_reviews.text: Nice and warm, a little bulky but gets better after wearing them a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Motorbike gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are good quality and warm. Only issue is that they are too big. But however my husband rides with them.
customer_reviews.author: mariko

customer_reviews.title: These are nice gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are nice gloves. fit good and keep hands warm in the winter. I haven't had to use in rain so can't comment about that.
customer_reviews.author: BlackCrowe

customer_reviews.title: They fit and keep the cold off my hands
customer_reviews.text: Exactly why I wanted thank you very much and a day ahead of time which is great
customer_reviews.author: Gary Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Super Good Value
customer_reviews.text: For the money, you can’t beat the value of these gloves. I am sure there are warmer and better quality gloves out there but these are solid and cost a fraction of those.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Craig

customer_reviews.title: warm gloves for the money
customer_reviews.text: These gloves work well in cold weather, 40 degrees and above. Not that cold where I live, so can't comment on below 40 degrees
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves, I have wide hands so I got ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice gloves, I have wide hands so I got them in a large thinking they may run a little small but the finger part is to long. A large is a large, I'll try a medium size.
customer_reviews.author: bill deyoe

customer_reviews.title: Not pretty but very warm
customer_reviews.text: Nice and warm used them on my motorcycle when it was in the 30’s and kept my hands warm. Bulky and not the prettiest but they definitely get the job done
customer_reviews.author: Anthony D.

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Not very comfortable hard to work controls on bike. But they are warm
customer_reviews.author: batman3w3

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: these are well made. very warm, allow great movement of fingers. as long as they dont raise price great buy bought 3 pairs at $11.99
customer_reviews.author: none

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully made and keeps the hands very warm especially in ...
customer_reviews.text: Received in plenty of time for a Christmas gift. Definitely leather. Wonderfully made and keeps the hands very warm especially in the wind. Best of all my husband loves them. Recommend them and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Very fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Product is as described. Great quality. Very fast shipping. I will order from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ordered extra large as I have pretty big nits and they are still a bit tight
customer_reviews.text: Ordered extra large as I have pretty big nits and they are still a bit tight. Other than that, they are some serious cold weather gloves. Picked these up to ride southern cali winters and let me tell you my hands sweat in these things even riding in 40 degrees. I'm also a person with a very high core temp so that may have something to do with that. If you sweat in them, make sure you hang them somewhere that they will get good airflow to dry the inside or you will have a handful of wet glove come the next morning.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in early January and while they did the job of keeping my hands warm during the early/late time of days' rides... It's now March and the seams are already tearing after normal use. Aside from that, I will note they were a bit larger than the recommended size for my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Amy S.

customer_reviews.title: A glove that fits like a glove should.
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat reluctant to order gloves for bikers but now that I did I am happy I did. Comfortable, warm and very protective of my hands.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Keeps hands warm
customer_reviews.text: Have worn these on a few very cold days. The long length kept the wind from going up my sleeves. Hands stayed warm. Gloves were not too thick to effect throttle or clutch.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: and feel comfortable. I have fairly large hands
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit perfectly, and feel comfortable. I have fairly large hands, so I ordered the 2xl per the size chart. I like the long cuff, should keep my wrists warm. Rugged looking and well made.
customer_reviews.author: John Poulos

customer_reviews.title: Men's Motorcycle Gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Way to big. Too cold for even a 50's ride in Florida. I would recommend spending a little more and get better quality pair.
customer_reviews.author: d2hound

customer_reviews.title: What every motorcycle tourer needs.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and comfortable. Will keep me warm this fall on motorcycle trip to the mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony B.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, fit and price
customer_reviews.text: Got here fast. Great quality XL fits like I'd expected for large hands. Bought for quad riding and warmth. Able to work brakes and throttle comfortably and keeps hands very warm. Not bulky Great fit. Priced great
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Moxley

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$ for sure
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The coldest temp I’ve ridden in so far is the mid to upper 50’s and they have kept my hands warm. In fact they got a little sweaty. I suspect they will work well in colder temps as well. I have a personal rule of 45 degrees F or more and I’ll go out riding. Ride safe everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love them so much I ordered a pair for myself also after trying his out!
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Nice and warm
customer_reviews.text: Very warm, nicely made and accurate in sizing. I wear an XL and these are comfortable but not loose.
customer_reviews.author: Kouri Carter

customer_reviews.title: the fit and the wreath
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to try them out it's a little wet around here now.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Majeski

customer_reviews.title: Nice warm leather gloves
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes these gloves very much. They are a little tight when he puts them on, but they will loosen as leather does. They are nice and warm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy C. Chamberlin

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: VERY NICE QUALITY SOFT AND VERY LIGHT WEIGHT BETTER THAN SOME MORE EXSPENSIVE GLOVES
customer_reviews.author: catfishjr241

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Husband is very p!eased with these gloves. They fit great and are well made.
customer_reviews.author: lovetoshop

customer_reviews.title: Good for cheap gloves
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof to a degree and cant ride for more than probably 20 minutes at 60mph without hands going numb in 36°(f) weather. Better than my makeshift gloves, but not the best. Good for the asking price
customer_reviews.author: Vl

customer_reviews.title: Stubby fingers
customer_reviews.text: Very warm but you need stubby fingers for them to fit. I have arthritis in my hands and the stubby fingers made the gloves very constricted feeling. They also feel like they have balls of cotton in the fingertips
customer_reviews.author: S. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Worth SO much more than the cost... Better than my $200-300 gloves from before!
customer_reviews.author: Trina Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Rode home the other night in 25° (real feel of 17) and these kept my hands (and fingers) toasty!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: 40 degrees and above is ok below 40 your pissed
customer_reviews.text: They look good and are leather. One of the zippers broke the 1st time I pit then on and then wasn't to far behind and they suck and need another layer on underneath them below 37 to 40. I in all weather. 40 degrees and up your formal day
customer_reviews.author: Clint S.

customer_reviews.title: they fit like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Well, they fit like a glove, are warm, cover where the wrists meet the jacket sleeve cuffs. Going to mink oil the tops to help weatherproof them.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W.

customer_reviews.title: Very good deal for the money. Durable, flexible, warm.
customer_reviews.text: The sizing did seem to run a little big when compared to others, but not so much that it rendered them unwearable for my wife and I.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M. Fecteau

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Vegas and it some morning rides to work are at 30 degrees. These have worked well for that. I wouldn't go much colder though. For the price, they are perfect for my intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Subtle Patriot

customer_reviews.title: They will work out great.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to use them yet but I think they will work out just fine. And for the price can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Scov

customer_reviews.title: They work well
customer_reviews.text: The gloves had a slight scuff on the palm, like they had been worn and returned or something. After checking them out completely, it just seemed to be flaw. They work well.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Fitment!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality gloves! The only thing is that the right glove feels a lot tighter than the left. So much so that my thumb, index and middle fingers ache after my ride. My previous gloves fit just right. But, still a good glove!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Naranjo

customer_reviews.title: Chinese trash
customer_reviews.text: The glove insulation has come inside out. The strap broke. In thirty degrees these gloves will not save your fingers on a ride. You will be frostbitten!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little tight. I should of went up a size but the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: Terry K

customer_reviews.title: Not very good quality gloves
customer_reviews.text: Not very good quality gloves. The large size was too small for me so I asked for an exchange. Waiting for the extra large to come but I don't have high hopes.
customer_reviews.author: AV

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These are good gloves. Not sure about the dead of winter but 35 degrees they were good riding.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: I live in Pa, I like to ride as long as I can all year and keep my hands dry in cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: John Ward

customer_reviews.title: Cheap af
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not real leather. Poor quality. The clips broke before it got out of the bag. It feels like if I sneeze into them they will tear like toilet paper
customer_reviews.author: troy smith

customer_reviews.title: Sewing came apart
customer_reviews.text: Sewing on edge came apart first time I used them. Sent message to saler but no reply back. Unhappy
customer_reviews.author: Lee Davis

customer_reviews.title: I ordered large and they fit great for having long skiny hands
customer_reviews.text: Just received them today, I ordered large and they fit great for having long skiny hands. Seem very warm but are not easy to hold things.
customer_reviews.author: Dalcorn

customer_reviews.title: THEY FIT. But my fingers don't like the gloves, they get cold.
customer_reviews.text: 35 degrees at 35 miles an hour for 5 miles, my fingers get cold. These gloves don't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality, especially for the price. It doesnt get that cold in the central valley in california, but it was about 45 degrees and my hands were getting sweaty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and toasty
customer_reviews.text: I have used these on rides in the upper 30s through low 40s. While many parts of me were very cold, my hands stayed nice and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Rode for an hour in 40F weather. Hands stayed warm and dry. Leather is thin. Great deal for less than $20.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bulky with low amount of warmth
customer_reviews.text: Not the warmest of gloves for the bulkiness of them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Estrada

customer_reviews.title: “Patrick are you crazy?” “No, I’m warm”
customer_reviews.text: They definitely work well keeping your hands warm! But I wish I ordered an xl instead of a large bc the finger length wasn’t long enough. Besides that they do their job.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are really great in Cold Weather. A little clumsy at first but after you get used to them, they are great.
customer_reviews.author: SciFi Fan

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Nice item fast delivery good seller would buy from this seller again quality I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Leo A. Amorin

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for riding in cold weather! I've not had to test them in rain yet, but they keep my hands warm and are the perfect size!
customer_reviews.author: Lesleigh

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not heavy leather but good for the price. Runs large IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth E. Hiser

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Rode motorcycle 25 miles to work at 45F degrees, hands stayed warm.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Sorenson

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Ripped At the cuff on the second ride. Will be returning
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Berlucchi

customer_reviews.title: NOT waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I like them, but they are NOT the least bit "waterproof." They soak up rain like a sponge!I XXL fits my big hands well. Pretty warm.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: These are genuine leather and are quite nice and warm. Good quality and attractive too.
customer_reviews.author: M. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves For Winter
customer_reviews.text: Gift for grandson and we both love them. Fit just right and they are very warm.
customer_reviews.author: Abstract Heart

customer_reviews.title: very warm
customer_reviews.text: I've ridden in low 40s to upper 30 degree temps. These keep my hand nice and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ok gloves
customer_reviews.text: size runs a bit smaller but a tight fit warm ok for the price
customer_reviews.author: alicia

customer_reviews.title: Glove Review
customer_reviews.text: The picture indicated a longer cuff than is actually present. Otherwise fine.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Warm, soft leather, bigger better because it has foam inside.
customer_reviews.author: Adiet

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves his new gloves. He will be warm during the cold days.
customer_reviews.author: Marianna Baiamonte

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: They feel of the gloves is really comfortable, and easily able to move your fingers. They are very warm, and stay very dry. Can't ask for more. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Norm

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves for cold weather motorcycle driving and skiing
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are warm, waterproof, and work well for motorcycle driving and skiing.
customer_reviews.author: frogs

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Generally happy with it. Feel only slightly cool when riding in 35F.
customer_reviews.author: Lex Nguyen

product_meta.title: Mens Motorbike Gloves Cold Weather Motorcycle Riding Glove Genuine Leather Black
product_meta.description:
Looking for a superior solution to keep your hands warm while you ride your motorcycle? Look no further than our men’s genuine leather, cold weather riding gloves! No matter when you choose to ride, do it while keeping your hands warm with these stylish and fitted leather gloves. We construct our fashionable and cozy gloves from real leather, meaning you can rely on them to last for years. Plus, these gloves aren’t just for one occasion! We’ve specifically designed these gloves to be used for a wide variety of activities. Whether you’re attending a business event, a wedding, or engaging in outdoor activities like bicycling, golf, or motorcycle riding, our gloves can give you the warm protection and grip your hands need. If you’re engaged in rough work or you need some extra heat for your hands, use these gloves as a thermal lining. They’ll slip under a pair of large gloves and cinch tight with their elastic at the wrist. They trap the heat inside, keeping your hands warm. Our gloves can fit most hand sizes and come in S, M, L, XL, and XXL. With a beautiful black coloring, these gloves will serve you well through all your parties or activities during the winter. Because of how versatile they are, these gloves make an excellent gift. Give them to your family members and friends whose hands need extra protection from the cold this season! Try our product for yourself and see how your hands can experience comfort and warmth this winter, regardless of what you’re doing.




PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Package Dimensions :14.6 x 6.9 x 2.4 inches; 7.2 Ounces
 * Item model number :13
 * Department :Mens
 * Date First Available :July 28, 2018
 * Manufacturer :Mrx Products
 * ASIN :B01N8P9CVC

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #202,952 in Automotive (See Top 100 in Automotive)  *  #394 inPowersports Gloves

Our gloves can fit most hand sizes and come in S, M, L, XL, and XXL. With a beautiful black coloring, these gloves will serve you well through all your parties or activities during the winter. Because of how versatile they are, these gloves make an excellent gift. Give them to your family members and friends whose hands need extra protection from the cold this season! Try our product for yourself and see how your hands can experience comfort and warmth this winter, regardless of what you’re doing.
feature_bullets: MADE FROM GENUINE LEATHER: To trust a product to protect your hands from the harsh winter chill, it needs to be heavy and fitted. We construct our pair of fashionable and cozy gloves from real leather, meaning you can count on them working for years. Try out our stylish leather gloves and experience professional protection from the cold like never before!

WIND & COLD PROTECTION : When you’re riding down the road, you don’t want to have to worry about cold, unprotected hands. Instead, you deserve to have gloves that are comfortable, have excellent grip, and will keep your hands protected from the chill. Our will protect your hands from cold and harsh winds.

GREAT THERMAL LINING: Part of what makes these gloves so great is their ability to function as a thermal lining. If your work requires you to wear heavy-duty gloves, you can slip these dress gloves underneath to help your hands stay warm. Keep them handy in your car or house so you can have warm hands regardless of the occasion.

ADJUSTABLE STRAP: We specifically designed our handwear to be adjustable for the rider wearing them. With the adjustable wrist straps, you can be in charge of your own comfort and decide how the tight the glove needs to be. Now, riding can be more comfortable than ever because you’re wearing a glove that was designed to fit you perfectly.

SIZES FOR EVERYONE: We understand that hands come in all sizes, and we’re happy to offer our customers the opportunity to choose the size that fits best. We’re pleased to offer glove sizes ranging from small, medium, large, and more! Please take the time to check our sizing chart so that you can choose the size that will best fit you!
